items.description: Light tan to reddish-brown, darkening after feeding.
items.title: Color

items.description: Wingless, with a wrinkled upper body.
items.title: Body

items.description: Oval and flat, unless they have recently fed.
items.title: Shape

items.description: About the size of an apple seed, or 5-7 mm.
items.title: Size

items.description: including hives and anaphylaxis (in rare cases)
items.title: Allergic reactions

items.description: Itching, redness, and swelling at the bite site
items.title: Skin Irritation

items.description: Stress, anxiety, and insomnia due to the discomfort and fear associated with bed bug infestations.
items.title: Psychological Impact

items.description: Scratching the bites can break the skin and increase the risk of bacterial or fungal infections.
items.title: Secondary Infections:

items.description: Shiny black or very dark brown with a large, rounded abdomen.
items.title: Female black _widow Body

items.description: Often has red and white bands or spots on the sides of the abdomen.
items.title: Male black _widow Markings

items.description: A red or orange hourglass shape on the underside of the abdomen, which can sometimes appear as two separate triangles or be faded.
items.title: Female black _widow Markings

items.description: Will have an hourglass shape that becomes more defined as they mature.
items.title: Juvenile black _widow Markings

items.description: Light brown or gray, with stripes and spots that are red, orange, or yellow.
items.title: Juvenile black _widow Body

items.description: About 1/4 to 1/3 inch long, though sizes can vary.
items.title: Female black _widow Size

items.description: Lighter brown or gray with a more elongated body.
items.title: Male black _widow Body

items.description: Much smaller than females, around 1/10 to 1/4 inch long.
items.title: Male black _widow Size

items.description: Young children, the very ill, and the elderly are at higher risk for severe complications and potentially fatal outcomes.
items.title: Risk factors

items.description: May feel like a simple pinprick and is often not noticed immediately.
items.title: Initial bite

items.description: A dull muscle ache can spread throughout the body.
items.title: Within hours

items.description: In rare cases, a black _widow bite can cause cardiac problems like heart inflammation, but this is usually reversible with treatment.
items.title: Cardiac issues

items.description: Can develop, including severe muscle cramps, abdominal pain, sweating, nausea, vomiting, and high blood pressure.
items.title: Serious symptoms

items.description: Call 911 or go to the emergency room immediately if you experience any of the following, especially if you are a child or an older adult: Severe pain or worsening whole-body symptomsDifficulty breathingHeart palpitations or racing pulseSigns of infection (fever or yellow discharge)Severe headache or vision problems
items.title: When to seek emergency care

items.description: Most healthy individuals recover fully within 24 to 48 hours, though milder symptoms can last for several weeks.
items.title: Recovery time

items.description: The bite area may swell, become painful, and develop redness or numbness.
items.title: Within an hour

items.description: There is a risk of secondary infection if the bite is not properly cleaned.
items.title: Infection risk
